== Output to screen ==
	=== amc.echo ===
	Print text to the main mud window.
    ==== Usage: ====
		`msg = amc.echo(text, fg-color (optional), bg-color (optional))`
		Examples:
		{{{
			msg = amc.echo("This is a test", "black", "green")
			amc.echo("Text on screen")
			amc.echo("Test me!", "crimson", "deepskyblue")
			amc.echo("Text", "#44cc00", "#000000")
		}}}
	The function returns the text parameter.
	=== amc.echowin ===
	Print text to a user created window.
	==== Usage: ====
		`msg = amc.echo(window, text, fg-color (optional), bg-color (optional))`
		Examples:
		{{{
			msg = amc.echo("chat", "This is a test in a window named 'chat'!", "black", "green")
			amc.echo("userwin1", "Text on screen")
			amc.echo("win", "Test me!", "crimson", "deepskyblue")
			amc.echo("window1", "Text", "#44cc00", "#000000")
       }}}
	The function returns the text parameter.
	=== amc.color ===
	Print colored text to the main mud window without creating a newline to create multicolored text lines.
    ==== Usage: ====
		`amc.color(text, fg-color (optional), bg-color (optional))`
		Examples:
		{{{
			amc.color("This is a test", "black", "green")
			amc.color("Text on screen")
			amc.color("Test me!", "crimson", "deepskyblue")
			amc.color("Text", "#44cc00", "#000000")
		}}}
		Create a line with multiple colors like this:
		{{{
			amc.echo("")
			amc.color("Text ", "red")
			amc.color("and text in green ", "green")
			amc.color("and text in cyan ", "cyan")
			amc.color("and so on!", "yellow")
	    }}}
	The function returns nothing.
	=== amc.colorwin ===
	Print colored text to a user created window without creating a newline to create multicolored text lines.
    ==== Usage: ====
		`amc.colorwin(window, text, fg-color (optional), bg-color (optional))`
		Examples:
		{{{
			amc.colorwin("chat", "This is a test", "black", "green")
			amc.colorwin("window", "Text on screen")
			amc.colorwin("win1", "Test me!", "crimson", "deepskyblue")
			amc.colorwin("testwin", "Text", "#44cc00", "#000000")
		}}}
		Create a line with multiple colors like this:
		{{{
			amc.echowin("test", "")
			amc.colorwin("test", "Text ", "red")
			amc.colorwin("test", "and text in green ", "green")
			amc.colorwin("test", "and text in cyan ", "cyan")
			amc.colorwin("test", "and so on!", "yellow")
	    }}}
	The function returns nothing.
